intro: Phacelia cumingii var. grandis, commonly known as the large phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and thrives in well-drained soils, often found in open grasslands and rocky areas. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value. Phacelia cumingii var. grandis is also valued for its role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
